definition: Feminism is being aware and supportive of women and their historical struggle - while feeling good about being masculine. It's not one or the other, both are possible and worth pursuing. Anyone who says otherwise is bitter.
What do you need today? Be direct if necessary.
Men and women can be equally as monstrous. Challenge people who say women are better than men, same as you would vice versa.
Gregg Wallace is one man, Marie Le Pen is one woman.
Mums don't "always know" - nobody does.
Making sure your needs aren’t met is a very easy way to make yourself needy
You're annoying, extremely stubborn and independent, lazy, frustratingly slow, rude, inconsistent, moody - but clearly extremely lovable despite this.

Making music is a great way to spend your time, no matter your state of employment. However, without a life outside of this, the music will probably be boring. What you channel into music is what makes it interesting.
I don’t care what age my friends are. Why would I hang out with someone my own age I don’t like, rather than someone younger or older that I do? I like a broad range of perspectives.
What's worse, having no status but not caring, or having status and desperately clinging to it - your self-worth dependent on other's approval?
Personal integrity will make you happier than chasing success.
You're passionate, you feel emotion strongly. Why is this a weakness and not a strength? Be more open about your feelings, express them proudly.
Be who you want to be. Take risks to be happy.
It's ok to feel pain and need a way to vent, it's a natural part of being human, but do your best to do something with forward momentum.
Do I overthink, or do others underthink? An unexamined life is to live by other people’s standards.
Don’t take the obvious choice we’re socially programmed to want -  go for what specifically you want.

I have the conviction to follow through with my creative pursuits, even when overworked or under tight time constraints. Encourage others with their creative pursuits and help if they ask for it, why be competitive?

Life is playful, like an ongoing piece of music. The idea is not to strive for the pot at the end of the rainbow, some end goal where you have “everything”, but to enjoy the process, through the ups and downs.
I value self-exploration through art and philosophy. I want to understand myself as a priority.
“In my music, I'm trying to play the truth of what I am. The reason it's difficult is because I'm changing all the time.” Charles Mingus
I value self-exploration through art and philosophy, as I think it makes me a more interesting person. I want to understand myself as a priority.

Frame Justifying: trying to mitigate or explain why your status is better than it looks, anxiously. A form of reframing. Eg. ‘I work in hospitality but I’m an Assistant General Manager with a salary.’ Eg. ‘I’m a rich kid but I’ve made my own way and had no help. Self made man.’ We try to cover up low status chips to our frame. This only comes across as insecure. Be honest and direct. ‘I have some wealth, I pursued my passion in my 20s. Who wouldn’t?’. No reframing.

Accolades and achievements are seductive for your self worth. I own 600 records. I got good grades. I had a threesome. I did x y and z. It's tempting to fall back on these in hard times ‘well at least I did x’ - but why not have self worth for simply having been? In the same way, why attach negative self esteem to bad past experiences ‘I fumbled the bag with her, I could have been in love’. All of this is framing, what information may or may not make you look better, but inside you should have consistent self worth. Try to distance your own self worth from your frame.
We’re all going to pop our clogs some day. Our houses ruins, or gone forever. What matters?

Is sex to you proving you are on a high, or higher rung of the ladder than either you are, or claim to be? Is sex an anxious peacock display of status and capitalist success - what kind of person will you attract if you beleive this?

Productivity is not just economic. Self-anaylsing and reflecting, taking time in isolation to confront yourself and your fears, for instance, could yield high rewards such as improved self-worth from a small investment, like a long walk in the park. A productive day can take many forms.

To me, a loser is someone who lives by a set of values not their own, not taking risks, confronting themselves in order to grow and playing the victim. In order to know your values however, you may need to go through phases of being a “loser”, be tested, to realize what your values even are. It's ok to have a bumpy ride, we're all losers sometimes.
Be a socialist who isn't an idealist. An artist who isn't mad.
Would you be offended if a gnat bit you?

Learning is a love of knowing. You could do this as a child, adult, or old person. Even if you had a year to live, if learning was what you wanted then do it, even if you never get to use it. It’s ok to just enjoy learning for it’s own sake.

If the raw animal inside of you believes something, the ‘shadow’ - and this belief does not contradict social norms - embody it immediately. Eg. “You can go to university at any age” - I believe that in my subconscious, and although it's unconventional, it's not ostracising as a belief. So say it without fear. Otherwise, at the very least acknowledge and respect that it's there, integrate and test it.
A broad range of friends gives a broad range of perspectives. Age, culture, gender, sexual preferences.
The arc of the conversation is often more important than the conclusion. Philosophy is exercise not truth.
There is no true beleif system, we wander from belief to belief, using it as a lens to help us understand ourselves.
What kind of person do you want to be like?
Don’t prove yourself. To anyone. Live by your own values and don't attach yourself to your frame. If how you seem is rotten to one person or group, it's almost certainly lovely to someone else.
Nothing wrong with feeling painful or grand emotions, if that’s who you are. Don’t be ashamed if a girl brings it out in you, be proud of being passionate.

Too much emphasis on how much: how many records does this DJ own; how many books have you read on this or that subject. Reading one book, or listening to one record and dedicating time to it is better. I don't need to see and hear it all, if it means sacrificing the depth of understanding. No one likes a mr or miss know it all who's always putting their hand up.
Are you judging anyone for their status, health, age, beauty or anything else?
I don’t want to compromise my music or art, so I don’t work my day job in the music industry. I like to keep music personal.
Help yourself or your kids first, then other adults. What do you need today?
Cats go after what they want, this is why we don't mess with them. We love them for it, even if it drives us mad.
"Still single?" is like asking "still in a relationship?". Much more important is are you happy or doing a good job in either one.
Why fantasise about proving yourself to someone - who cares what they think - what do you think?
Integrate all parts of yourself, especially the repressed parts.
It's ok to surrender sometimes. You lost.
Make a committment today to someone, and keep it.
Don't let the bastards grind you down.
Appreciate your loved ones now, even if their habits make you angry or frustrated. You'll only have them once. Relish being annoyed at them!
If you did not care what other people thought about you, how would you live differently?
Don't wait, do it now.
Try to be on time today
What's something fun or sweet you want to do for a loved one today, wanting nothing in return?
What are you scared of at the moment? Identify it and do it.
